author: 0x1984
content: Less about rejected EIPs, but more about hotly debated EIPs(for example, cut slot time to 1/2 & keep gas limit, or simply double gas limit). And in the future it’s going to have similar EIPs in such nature that it might be a good idea but there is no data backing it. It could not be devnet as it needs wide participation. It could not be Sepolia or Holeski as they are used regularly. Then it can just be a fork of Holeski. One extra DevOps engineer can handle the branching and deployment of this extra testnet

author: sky.cactus
content: I haven't been paying close attention to ACD.  Has it been decided that we don't really care about disk growth anymore, or that we are willing to take on debt today in hopes that future hypothetical improvements will address the disk problem?

author: sky.cactus
content: In the past when I would bring up the issue it would get some mumbles of semi-agreement, but it feels like these days it only receives pushback, but maybe I'm missing some context.

author: yorickdowne
content: I’m not part of ACD. From the outside, it looks as if disk space worries are being taken seriously enough to expire pre-merge history by May 1st 2025, which kicks the can down the road for another year to get full 4444 - or at least more expiry.

author: sky.cactus
content: Is 4444 actually being implemented and is it generally agreed on as a good thing?  Last I heard it was still undecided, and it sounds like people want to increase disk growth now and figure out whether we will do 4444 or not later.

author: yorickdowne
content:
My very unscientific Xitter poll with n=~55 shows some 47% ish of responders wanting to stay on 2TB, and the rest are either on 4TB or are planning to move to 4TB.

Pre-merge expiry would allow that 2TB group to run for another year.

author: yorickdowne
content: Your finger is closer to the pulse than mine on that. I saw “all client teams have agreed to expire pre-merge history by May 1st 2025” which at least sounds like 4444 is still on the table.

author: milos88
content: Current agreement between execution client teams is that every client will be free to drop pre-merge bodies and receipts on May 1st. Which is partial step towards full 4444. More details in <#953349957400821860> channel

author: parithosh
content:
This is actually what we do today, if there's an intent to bump gas limit or blob count then we run some tests to see what the impacts would be. Mekong(temporary testnet) for e.g had the gas limit at 36M before any of the other testnets, second was sepolia. We additionally did local devnets with kurtosis to check the impact as well. However assigning a person to do this all the time feels un-necessary to me, if there's intent we have and would assign someone to the task. 

However slot times are a much more fundamental change and cannot be touched without deep involvement of client teams as there are enough implications that need thinking through. afaik there's no immediate push to change slot times.
